intro: Cyclea pendulina, commonly known as the hanging cyclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are clustered in terminal panicles and bloom during the wet season, attracting various pollinators.
